pullRequest.title: Fix #260: Add/remove missing/outdated documentation from DMP
pullRequest.bodyText:
Removed parameters: healthChecks, loadNameParameters, portPropertyFile since they are not referenced in code
Remove <run> and <external> from Image Configuration docs
Added missing ImageName configuration section. We don't need to add Container Names
and Name Patterns since image builds don't really work with patterns and we don't
manipulate individual containers while doing a hot reload during watch(we're updating
image which triggers a rolling update).

Description

Type of change


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 Feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change
 Chore (non-breaking change which doesn't affect codebase;
test, version modification, documentation, etc.)

Checklist

 I have read the contributing guidelines
 I signed-off my commit with a user that has signed the Eclipse Contributor Agreement
[ ]~ I Added CHANGELOG entry~
 I have implemented unit tests to cover my changes
 I have updated the documentation accordingly
 No new bugs, code smells, etc. in SonarCloud report
 I tested my code in Kubernetes
 I tested my code in OpenShift

nodes.bodyText: Don't we no longer support Docker-Machine in Windows?
nodes.diffHunk:

 == Docker Access
 
-WARNING: This section is work-in-progress and not yet finished
-
-For {cluster} builds the {plugin} uses the Docker remote API so the URL of your Docker Daemon must be specified. The URL can be specified by the dockerHost or machine configuration, or by the `DOCKER_HOST` environment variable. If not given
+For {cluster} builds the {plugin} uses the Docker remote API so the URL of your Docker Daemon must be specified. The URL can be specified by the dockerHost or by the `DOCKER_HOST` environment variable.
 
 The Docker remote API supports communication via SSL and
 authentication with certificates.  The path to the certificates can
-be specified by the certPath or machine configuration, or by the
+be specified by the certPath or by the

beforeCommit.message:
Fix #260: Add/remove missing/outdated documentation from DMP

+ Remove references to docker-machine since it is not applicable
  in JKube which targets Kubernetes
+ Removed parameters: healthChecks, loadNameParameters, portPropertyFile since they are not referenced in code
+ Remove `<run>` and `<external>` from Image Configuration docs
+ Added missing ImageName configuration section. We don't need to add Container Names
  and Name Patterns since image builds don't really work with patterns and we don't
  manipulate individual containers while doing a hot reload during watch(we're updating
  image which triggers a rolling update).

afterCommit.message:
Fix #260: Add/remove missing/outdated documentation from DMP

+ Removed parameters: loadNameParameters, portPropertyFile since they are not referenced in code
+ Remove `<run>` and `<external>` from Image Configuration docs
+ Add missing HealthCheck section
+ Added missing ImageName configuration section. We don't need to add Container Names
  and Name Patterns since image builds don't really work with patterns and we don't
  manipulate individual containers while doing a hot reload during watch(we're updating
  image which triggers a rolling update).

nodes.bodyText: please do keep this as real XML comments, some syntax highlighting machines will break when processing this and also this code is not copy-pasteable since that is not a valid XML syntax.
Why is this no longer a heading? did the document structure change? Maybe we want it to be an H4?

commit.message:
Fix #260: Add/remove missing/outdated documentation from DMP

+ Removed parameters: loadNameParameters, portPropertyFile since they are not referenced in code
+ Remove `<run>` and `<external>` from Image Configuration docs
+ Add missing HealthCheck section
+ Added missing ImageName configuration section. We don't need to add Container Names
  and Name Patterns since image builds don't really work with patterns and we don't
  manipulate individual containers while doing a hot reload during watch(we're updating
  image which triggers a rolling update).
